docs.text: poster boy for co-dependency needs patching
docs.label: negative

docs.text: patch adams a film review by michael redman copyright 1999 by michael redman
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mediocrity is a pox on civilization .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in our heavily consumer oriented society , there is an enormous demand to churn out " stuff . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what would happen to our economy if we didn't feel the need to have more things ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to make us buy more , businesses need to produce a ton of product .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the sheer volume of items necessitates that most of them are of dubious quality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film industry is like any other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in order for studios to survive , they have to make money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the prevailing attitude is that more films equal more profit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some movies obviously exist only to put wares on the screen and to do that , less talented people are used .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there aren't enough great directors and actors to create the number of films necessary .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for some reason , it's never crossed anyone's mind that the real equation is quality films = more profit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: often , mediocre films are more of a pain for the audience than the horrendous ones .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at you can have a good time making fun of bad movies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm not suggesting that " patch adams " was tossed out just to rake in the bucks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: my guess is that someone was asleep at the wheel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it features an accomplished actor and a potentially engrossing story , but it's as dull as could be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hunter " patch " adams' ( robin williams ) desire to become a doctor has an unusual genesis .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: checking himself into a mental institute after a suicide attempt , he discovers that he can help the other patients by clowning around .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: patch could be a poster boy for co-dependency .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he explains that he likes devoting himself to others because then he doesn't focus on his own problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he decides that he wants to be a physician , leaves the place and a couple of years later enrolls in the medical college of virginia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a med student , patch's antics at the school's hospital catch the attention of his soon to be arch-enemy , straight-laced dean walcott ( bob gunton ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the dean is so opposed to the goofiness that he wants patch kicked out of school although he's one of the top students .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he writes in patch's academic file that he shows " excessive happiness . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i walked into the film knowing little about its history and wondered about its odd mechanical pacing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there also seemed to be no reason that it is set in the early seventies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then it struck me .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it must be based on a true story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie is an adaptation of a book by hunter adams who founded the gesundheit institute , a free clinic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: robin williams is an amazing actor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while he is adept at dramatic roles , his forte is over-the-top free spirits .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's what makes his failure here so remarkable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: patch is exactly the character he should be best at , yet even the scene where he and another mental patient are battling fierce imaginary squirrels falls flat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: something holds him back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the rest of the cast is two-dimensional .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for a film that champions seeing patients as human beings , it's curious that the ones here are cardboard characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: peter coyote as a man dying of cancer is refreshing because he seems like a real person .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately he's in the film for only about two minutes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the audience is blatantly lead by a ring in its nose from scene to scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're not left to our own emotional decisions : we're hit over the head with them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: shaved-headed children with cancer , an elderly woman whom patch makes laugh , a beautiful woman who can't love because of her abusive history .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when a group of students fix up an old house to use as a clinic in the andy hardy " hey , let's put on a play !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we can use the barn and my mom can make the curtains ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mode , they laugh and roll around while painting each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there might as well be giant signs flashing : " feel good now ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " feel bad now ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " patch " is a good title for the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is a patchwork of every manipulative scene you can think of .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the full-of-life student fights stodgy establishment types .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a touching death .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then there's another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film doesn't trust us to get it the first time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the dean tries to kick patch out and later he tries again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: worst of all is the final courtroom bit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: scary-looking old men sit in judgment of a man who only wants to help people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the room is packed with patch's supporters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: williams makes a supposedly impassioned speech about the humanity of all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it has as much emotion as his earlier statement " humans are the only animal that kills members of its own species " contains truth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the blame must be placed with the director tom shadyac and screenwriter steve oedekerk .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: shadyac also directed the first " ace ventura " movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oedekerk directed the second one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: need i say more ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real adams is to be admired for his devotion to treating patients as people rather than diseases .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film has a number of worthy messages about the state of the modern medical business with hmos and managed care .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the " doctors are not gods " theme will resonate with a number of people , but it's so poorly produced that no one will care .
docs.label: negative
